brief_summary.textblock:
A clinical study to determine the efficacy and safety of MK0869 in the treatment of
      depression.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Patients With Major Depressive Disorder With MK0869 (0869-063)

detailed_description.textblock: The duration of treatment is 8 weeks.

clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Multicenter, Placebo Controlled, Acute and Extension Study of 2 Doses of MK0869 in the Treatment of Patients With Major Depressive Disorder

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: HAMD-17 total score at week 8. Tolerability.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

results_reference.citation: Keller M, Montgomery S, Ball W, Morrison M, Snavely D, Liu G, Hargreaves R, Hietala J, Lines C, Beebe K, Reines S. Lack of Efficacy of the Substance P (Neurokinin(1) Receptor) Antagonist Aprepitant in the Treatment of Major Depressive Disorder. Biol Psychiatry. 2005 Oct 21; [Epub ahead of print]

secondary_outcome.measure: CGI-I Scale score at week 8 and at least a 50% reduction in the HAMD-17 total score.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
